title: South Granville: Wild wedding party on Sydney street swarms police car
text:
A police car with its sirens blaring has been surrounded by a large and raucous wedding party, temporarily stopping the driver from moving on the road.

A police car with its sirens blaring has been surrounded by a large and raucous wedding party, temporarily stopping the officer from moving their vehicle on the road.

The loud group of dozens of men, some women and a bride were chanting and clapping on the road around a NSW Highway Patrol vehicle at the wedding in South Granville, in western Sydney.

The jubilant group mostly ignored the police car’s siren, beating drums and dancing in front of the car as it slowly tried to move forwards.

The loud group chanted and blew whistles around the car, with some in wedding gowns and others dressed in more casual gear. The police car eventually was able to move away from the group as it parted. The vehicle did a U-turn and parked on the opposite side of the road.

A video of the wild street party was shared to the Facebook group Auburn 2144, where commenters said the video had been filmed at a wedding over the weekend.

A NSW Police spokesperson told news.com.au no action was taken by police when they attended the party.

“Police attended a location in South Granville on Sunday, 13 October 2019 in response to a complaint to ensure a smooth flow of traffic and pedestrian safety,” a spokeperson said.

“Motorists and pedestrians complied and no further action was required to be taken by police.”

Confused commenters on the post struggled to understand exactly what was happening.

“Is this a protest?” one commenter asked.

“No it’s someone’s wedding,” another said.

“Typical Sydney weddings,” another joked.

Another commenter was shocked that “even the bride” was involved in the street party around the police car.

But not everybody thought it was funny, some calling the group “disrespectful”.

“Get off the road and be decent human beings the world doesn’t revolve around them,” one irate commenter said.

“This was a few doors up from my house,” another said. “I’m not sure when the cops came, but the smell of burnt rubber was so bad I could smell it from inside my house.

“Guildford Road is a main road, have your send off, but to block a main road for that long was ridiculous.”

The post has attracted more than 500 reactions and more than 400 comments.
description: A police car with its sirens blaring has been surrounded by a large and raucous wedding party, temporarily stopping the officer from moving their vehicle on the road.
